snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio said that his administration was on pace to meet his 10-year goal for creating or preserving affordable housing units, but his predecessor might take issue with his first-year tally.
abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio says his administration has funded over 17,300 affordable homes during its first year in office, bringing New York City closer to his pledge to build 200,000 affordable units over decade; records suggest, however, that projects begun under Mayor Michael Bloomberg may be partially responsible for numbers.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio said that his administration was on pace to meet his 10-year goal for creating or preserving affordable housing units, but his predecessor might take issue with his first-year tally.

headline.main: By Highlighting Gains in Affordable Housing, de Blasio Raises a Counting Question
headline.print_headline: By Highlighting Housing Gains, de Blasio Raises a Counting Question
